content:
The Aliz Hotel is a fantastic choice, and the year-round rooftop bar is definitely a perk. You'll be able to enjoy the city views and cocktails even in the colder months.

Before you book, I just want to highlight a few more things to consider:

* **Room Categories:** The Aliz Hotel offers several room categories, including some with city views. If you want to splurge, consider booking a room with a view of the Manhattan skyline.
* **Breakfast Options:** The Aliz Hotel doesn't offer a free breakfast buffet, but you can purchase breakfast at their on-site restaurant, Farm to Table, or explore nearby cafes and eateries.
* **Noise Level:** As with any hotel in Midtown, you may encounter some street noise. If you're a light sleeper, consider requesting a room on a higher floor or away from the street.

To book your stay at The Aliz Hotel, I recommend checking the hotel's website, as well as online travel agencies like Expedia, Booking.com, or Hotels.com. Compare prices and look for any available deals or packages.

Additionally, consider booking a room with a flexible cancellation policy, in case your plans change.

If you have any more questions or need help with booking, feel free to ask!
